The short-term time horizon normally lasts one year, from the end of the reporting period.
The length of the short-term time horizon is defined as the period adopted by the undertaking in
its financial statement as the reporting period; this period extends from the end of the reporting
period into the future (ESRS 1 paragraph 77 (a)).
